metadata.title: CVE-2021-20251 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in samba. A race condition in the password lockout code may lead to the risk of brute force attacks being successful if special conditions are met.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20251` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
ldb-tools - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libldb2 - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
python3-ldb - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
python3-samba - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> Samba team considers this issue not serious enough for an advisory, and did not publish updates for releases earlier than 4.16

criterions.comment: samba package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1').
